SENT.plain: OBJECTIVES: Mutations in the dysferlin gene cause two autosomal recessive forms of muscular dystrophy: Miyoshi myopathy and limb-girdle muscular dystrophy type 2B
The purpose of this study was to diagnose a Chinese pedigree with the autosomal recessive form of muscular dystrophy and conduct mutational screening
METHODS: The pedigree was diagnosed accurately by using two-point linkage analysis and multi-Western blot analysis
Mutations were determined by reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) followed by DNA sequencing
RESULTS: Two-point linkage analysis showed significant LOD scores with makers from chromosome 2p13
Multi-Western blot analysis confirmed dysferlin deficiency of muscle specimen from the propositus
Mutation analysis of the dysferlin gene revealed a novel mutation, 6429delG, on exon 53
CONCLUSIONS: We identified an inbred Chinese pedigree with Miyoshi myopathy caused by the 6429delG mutation in the dysferlin gene
This mutation is predicted to result in premature termination of translation contributing to Miyoshi myopathy
